io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock

Class DefaultOwnedStock

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock.AbstractStock
      • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock.DefaultStock
        • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock.DefaultOwnedStock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OwnedStock, Stock, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<AbstractStock>

    @ThreadSafe
 @Entity
public class DefaultOwnedStock
extends DefaultStock
implements OwnedStock
    This implementation of the OwnedStock interface extends the DefaultStock class and builds on it with the properties of the new interface. This class is intended to be used either as a decorator around an AbstractStock implementation, or as a stand-alone class instantiated with a stock's symbol passed to it.

    The main interaction with this class is through the increaseShares() and decreaseShares() methods, which adjust all the values of this class. Private setter methods do exist, however, to facilitate compatibility with the StockFileDownloader class, which uses the stock downloading process to load values into this class from a saved source.

    The Map returned by the getValueMap() method has been altered to add additional fields to it: QUANTITY_OF_SHARES, TOTAL_VALUE, and NET. Constants have been added to this class that represent the keys for these new entries in the map.

    THREAD SAFETY: This class is nearly entirely thread safe. All mutable state is guarded by this class's intrinsic lock, as all of the state fields are interconnected.

    The only potential hole in this class's thread safety is the StockDownloader object it depends on. If the downloader used in conjunction with this class is not thread safe, then the thread safety of this entire class could be compromised. If, however, it is thread safe, then this class can be properly relied upon in a concurrent environment.

    Version:
    2.3
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    StockDownloader, StockFileDownloader, Serialized Form

      • DefaultOwnedStock

        public DefaultOwnedStock(java.lang.String symbol)

        Parameters:

      • DefaultOwnedStock

        public DefaultOwnedStock(Stock stock)
        Copy constructor for DefaultOwnedStock. Creates a deep copy of the stock parameter. Accepts all kinds of stock objects, and parses the object along the way to check for which fields to set.

        NOTE: This does NOT guarantee that all fields of this class will have a value. Whether a field will have a value or be null is determined entirely by whether is has a value or is null in the stock parameter being copied. In addition, this constructor accepts Stock objects that are NOT OwnedStocks. If that is the case, all the OwnedStock values will be set to 0.

        Parameters:
        stock - the stock to copy to this class.

      • addShares

        public void addShares(int quantity)
        Description copied from interface: OwnedStock
        Add the specified number of shares of this stock. The number of shares added is multiplied by the current share price to get the amount to increase the total value. The principle and net are also updated accordingly.

        The stock details must be set before adding/subtracting any shares. If they have not been set, an exception is thrown.

        Specified by:
        addShares in interface OwnedStock
        Parameters:
        quantity - the quantity of shares to add.

      • subtractShares

        public java.math.BigDecimal subtractShares(int quantity)
        Description copied from interface: OwnedStock
        Subtract the specified number of shares from this stock. The number of shares subtracted is multiplied by the current share price to get the amount to decrease the total value by. The principle and net are also updated accordingly. Finally, the method returns the value of the shares that were subtracted, the "profit" from a sale.

        The stock details must be set before adding/subtracting any shares. If they have not been set, an exception is thrown.

        Specified by:
        subtractShares in interface OwnedStock
        Parameters:
        quantity - the quantity of shares to decrease by.
        Returns:
        the value of the shares that were subtracted.

      • setStockDetails

        public void setStockDetails(StockDownloader downloader,
                            boolean fullDetails)
                     throws InvalidStockException,
                            java.net.UnknownHostException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Download the details of this stock. The values retrieved should be set as fields in this class.

        The boolean fullDetails parameter should be kept constant with the getValueMap() method of this class. That is to say that when this parameter is false, the same subset of fields is used in both of these methods.

        The list of fields to download passed to the StockDownloader object should be based on constant properties the downloader will recognize. The public fields provided here are mean to fulfill this purpose.

        StockFileDownloader: This downloader can be used with this method as a way of updating OwnedStock properties after loading a saved portfolio. This type of StockDownloader should only be used with fullDetails set to false, as it only contains a subset of the stock data.

        Specified by:
        setStockDetails in interface Stock
        Overrides:
        setStockDetails in class DefaultStock
        Parameters:
        downloader - the StockDownloader utility to get this stock's values.
        fullDetails - if true, downloads the values for all the stock's fields. If false, only downloads a limited set of values for a "quick-view".
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if this stock is not a valid stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web server to download stock details, most likely due to lack of an internet connection.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download and parse the stock details.
        See Also:
        StockDownloader

      • getModifiableValueMap

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getModifiableValueMap(boolean fullDetails)
        Description copied from class: AbstractStock
        Returns a modifiable Map of all the values contained in this stock, as opposed to getValueMap() which returns an unmodifiable Map. This method should be the one overriden and configured with the necessary values, as it is invoked when getValueMap is called.

        This method should always ONLY return a modifiable Map, to later be wrapped in an unmodifiable Map. This allows further subclasses to continue to override this method to add additional values to the Map without having to worry about Map immutability.

        Overrides:
        getModifiableValueMap in class DefaultStock
        Parameters:
        fullDetails - whether or not the Map should contain all the values of this stock.
        Returns:
        a Map of the values of this stock.
        See Also:
        AbstractStock.getValueMap()

      • addShares

        public void addShares(OwnedStock stock)
        Description copied from interface: OwnedStock
        Add the shares of the OwnedStock parameter to this stock, only if the parameter is the same stock as this one (ie, has the same symbol). If it is not the same stock as this one, an exception is thrown. This method is a helper method for adding shares, and should be used with a more recently updated OwnedStock object as its parameter.

        The stock details must be set before adding/subtracting any shares. If they have not been set, an exception is thrown.

        The current share price is also updated during this operation. This method operates on the assumption that the stock parameter has had its details updated more recently than this object has been, and it sets the current price of the parameter as the current price of this whole object. This is done prior to the operations to update the principle, total value, and net.

        Specified by:
        addShares in interface OwnedStock
        Parameters:
        stock - the stock who's shares are to be added to this one.

      • subtractShares

        public java.math.BigDecimal subtractShares(OwnedStock stock)
        Description copied from interface: OwnedStock
        Subtract the shares of the OwnedStock parameter to this stock, only if the parameter is the same stock as this one (ie, has the same symbol). If it is not the same stock as this one, an exception is thrown. This method is a helper method for subtracting shares, and should be used with a more recently updated OwnedStock object as its parameter. Finally, the method returns the value of the shares that were subtracted, the "profit" from a sale.

        The stock details must be set before adding/subtracting any shares. If they have not been set, an exception is thrown.

        The current share price is also updated during this operation. This method operates on the assumption that the stock parameter has had its details updated more recently than this object has been, and it sets the current price of the parameter as the current price of this whole object. This is done prior to the operations to update the principle, total value, and net.

        Specified by:
        subtractShares in interface OwnedStock
        Parameters:
        stock - the stock who's shares are to be added to this one.
        Returns:
        the value of the shares that were subtracted.
